Summarize findings to formulate a general rule or expression relating k to the count of m-values in the set {k+3, k+4, ..., 2k} satisfying f(m) divisible by 3.

Express \( f(x) \) in terms of \( x-k \), i.e., as \( f(x) = f(k) + (x-k)g(x) \) for some polynomial \( g(x) \).
Analyze the divisibility of \( f(k+3), f(k+4), ..., f(k+n) \) by 3 using the expression \( f(x) = f(k) + (x-k)g(x) \).
